s.text: Merengue is terrific music, too, but when, half a century ago, Trujillo ordered that sound systems be set up to play it all over the Dominican Republic, it wasn't to "uplift" people but to render them passive.
The New Radicals sound like Todd Rundgren has just emerged from the cryogenics lab where he's lain frozen since 1972.

Merengue is terrific music, too, but when, half a century ago, Trujillo ordered that sound systems be set up to play it all over the Dominican Republic, it wasn't to "uplift" people but to render them passive.

But you've certainly hit on something by focusing on Miller's partiality to music that "brings us all together."
A Beatles biographer, I forget which one, once said that Sgt. Pepper "brought the world closer together than any event since the Congress of Vienna."

Beck, whom I find a consistent delight, seems to draw from less mainstream stuff--a hybrid of Prince and that terrific high-tech British duo Godley Creme (who had a pop incarnation as 10cc).
Sheryl Crow's guitar licks seem so familiar that I have often suspected they're simply mixed out of "Stuck in the Middle With You."
